messages: 1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (01:51): how to list all possible highlightings keywords for echohl ?
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (01:54): and a second question, how to prevent write in a file ? (I mean a script open a file in a new split, allow user to modify it, but not to write (:w) it ... )
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (01:54): is there a way to do that ?
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (01:57): no, set nowrite sets it for all buffers
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (01:57): not only for the current buffer
4797d6c9a384b9d252cb39a172693d14 (01:59): hmm, deryni, i want to map <F3> to do two commands. What characters will i need between the two commands?
a9c6b4c6ccd5443c668060e7ece01ccf (02:03): when I have made a change to the colour scheme, what is an easy way to reload it?
4797d6c9a384b9d252cb39a172693d14 (02:04): precisely what im looking for. many thanks again

1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:09): what is the command to replace the content of the file by the content of the copy/paste register ? (I thought :%put but it inserts the content of the clipboard after the end line ... )

1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:11): I understand why it did ... but that didn't give me how to do what I wanted ;) (and still, I know what's a register, but that does not give me a clue about replacing the buffer content ...)
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:15): thanks thats exactly what I wanted (I just hope it'll work in a script too)
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:19): hum that does not work in a script :( how to enter visual commands into a script ?
4797d6c9a384b9d252cb39a172693d14 (02:20): map <F3> :unmap <MiddleMouse> | :iunmap <MiddleMouse><CR>    does work, even though the two commands seperately work
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:30): ghaaa, I don't find the solution!
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:31): I want to replace the content of the second buffer using the content of the first buffer
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:31): the first buffer has the cursor focus
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:32): in the script I tried: %y | quit! | %"_d | put
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:32): but it seems I the %"_d does not work ...
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:33): (it's not working better if I try to enter a command directly ...)
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:34): damn, I didn' t see I can put the register name as an argument
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:34): is "%y thing only working in Visual mode ?
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (02:34): and "% is not what you have in mind I guess :)
1dba936eb9afcdae7d12168442487415 (02:53): if you guys want to try it out I would be glad to receive bug reports/comments/feedback  :)

30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:34): it's a site. With a game in it
30acf32f65007f527c482fef01043f22 (03:34): not sure what the nature of it is

b6482332eaf81d2af7e6889e7f7882bb (04:13): What is the vim equivalent of the perl $1 in a regex?
b6482332eaf81d2af7e6889e7f7882bb (04:13): but i want the [a-z] group to go into the substituted expr.
4f121933e01ce1faf5dbbc2de44e632a (04:15): AI_coder: it's \1, but it won't work for that re., I suppose you want \0
